intro: Sida sbarpiana, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its soft, silky hairs that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Sida sbarpiana is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
